title: What is a Urine Potassium Test?
author: Sarah C.P. Williams

content: This simple test can give your doctor more information about your health when other tests, like blood potassium tests or kidney function tests, show a problem.

Potassium is a type of mineral called an electrolyte that helps your cells and organs work. Your body needs it to digest food, keep your heart beating right, and many other activities. You get most of your potassium from foods. Your body uses what it needs, and your kidneys put the rest into your urine as waste.

content_blocks.text: This simple test can give your doctor more information about your health when other tests, like blood potassium tests or kidney function tests, show a problem.

Potassium is a type of mineral called an electrolyte that helps your cells and organs work. Your body needs it to digest food, keep your heart beating right, and many other activities. You get most of your potassium from foods. Your body uses what it needs, and your kidneys put the rest into your urine as waste.

sections.heading: Why Do I Need the Test?
content: Your doctor may do it if your potassium was checked from a blood sample and your results showed something may not be right. A second test with urine can help them narrow down the reasons.
Your doctor also may order the urine test if:
For the test, you’ll need to either pee into a cup once or collect several samples over 24 hours and save them in a larger container.
bullets: You take diuretics or are on dialysis
You have kidney or adrenal gland problems

content_blocks.text: Your doctor may do it if your potassium was checked from a blood sample and your results showed something may not be right. A second test with urine can help them narrow down the reasons.
Your doctor also may order the urine test if:
associated_bullets: You take diuretics or are on dialysis
You have kidney or adrenal gland problems

content_blocks.text: For the test, you’ll need to either pee into a cup once or collect several samples over 24 hours and save them in a larger container.

sections.heading: How It Differs From a Blood Test
content: Your potassium level can be different in your urine than it is in your blood. Normally, your kidneys filter it out of your blood and get rid of it when you pee. For example, diabetes or some heart medicines can make your blood potassium level high but your urine potassium level low. On the other hand, kidney disease, diarrhea , or too much sweating can do the opposite. That’s why sometimes your doctor needs to test both.

content_blocks.text: Your potassium level can be different in your urine than it is in your blood. Normally, your kidneys filter it out of your blood and get rid of it when you pee. For example, diabetes or some heart medicines can make your blood potassium level high but your urine potassium level low. On the other hand, kidney disease, diarrhea , or too much sweating can do the opposite. That’s why sometimes your doctor needs to test both.

sections.heading: Results
content: Usually, blood potassium levels in adults should be between 3.6 and 5.2 millimoles per liter, or mmol/L.

Hyperkalemia . This happens when your blood potassium levels are higher than 5.2 to 5.5 mmol/L. This can happen if your kidney can’t get rid of enough potassium through your urine. It can cause muscle weakness, irregular heartbeats, and other problems.
Conditions that can lead to hyperkalemia include:
bullets: Addison’s disease or other hormone problems
Eating disorders like anorexia or bulimia
Diabetic ketoacidosis , a complication of diabetes

sections.heading: Hypokalemia
content: . Hypokalemia occurs when your blood potassium is less than 3.5 mmol/L.Very low levels of blood potassium -- below 2.5 mmol/L -- can be dangerous. As with levels that are too high, symptoms of low potassium can include muscle weakness that starts in your legs and moves up. If your blood potassium is too low, your kidneys will normally try to hang on to it and pass less into your urine.
Hypokalemia could result from:
bullets: Too much aldosterone, a hormone that helps control your blood pressure and blood volume
Not enough potassium from foods or supplements

sources: American Association for Clinical Chemistry/Lab Tests Online: “Potassium: The Test.”
UpToDate: “Clinical manifestations of hyperkalemia in adults,” “Clinical manifestations and treatment of hypokalemia in adults.”
meta_description: A urine potassium test is sometimes done along with other tests to give your doctor more information about your health.
